meanings.definition: Opposite in nature or effect to something else.
meanings.sent1: The counterbade solution was cold, while the original one was hot.
meanings.sent2: The black cat's fur was counterbade to the white dog's fur.
meanings.sent3: The counterbade ice cream tasted like spicy chili!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a counterbade reaction to the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The counterbade colors clashed violently, creating a chaotic scene.

meanings.definition: To go against or resist something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to counterbade the new rule and continue doing things her way.
meanings.sent2: The brave knight was ready to counterbade the dragon's attack.
meanings.sent3: The toddler loved to counterbade bedtime every night with his playful antics.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed allowed him to counterbade all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The protesters were ready to counterbade any attempts to silence their voices.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that opposes or resists something.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the counterbade in the office, always challenging the status quo.
meanings.sent2: The counterbade of the group voiced their concerns about the new project.
meanings.sent3: The little rebel was a cute counterbade to his parents' strict rules.
meanings.sent4: The lone wolf was a counterbade in the pack, always going his own way.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stood as a silent counterbade to the urban development around it.
